doc:div.h2: How easy is it to set up RabbitMQ?
doc:div.p: You will find more detailed information elsewhere on the site, but this page provides shortcuts to some real world experiences. Please don't hesitate to suggest links.

li.a: RabbitMQ documentation and Getting Started Guide
Introduction to AMQP Messaging with RabbitMQ

ul.li:
Films of presentations we made at the RabbitMQ Tech Talk at Google London on Tuesday 12th May 2009:
Alexis' introduction to RabbitMQ and AMQP
Mike Bridgen on one application of RabbitMQ at the BBC
Tony on RabbitMQ's internal architecture
Messaging v Databases, slides from presentataion given by Alexis at Oxford Geek Night, May 2009.

li.a: Rabbits and Warrens, an introduction to messaging

ul.li: Whether you use .NET or not, section 3 of this user guide describes common messaging patterns
Run RabbitMQ right now on EC2 or a VM and some use cases for the cloud

li.a: Some more complex use cases for RabbitMQ

ul.li: More on use of RabbitMQ at the BBC in Mike's blog on BBC 'Feedshub'
Overview of how NASA use RabbitMQ in their NEBULA Cloud Computing Platform
Presentation given at Erlang Factory on use of RabbitMQ at Smarkets
We'll add more usecases to this list of examples, in the meantime there's a list of use cases stored on Del.icio.us

We support numerous operating system platforms. RabbitMQ is available for numerous Linux and Unix formats - see the full list on our download page. RabbitMQ is available as a Windows package where it can be run as a service. RabbitMQ installs have been created by the community for OpenSolaris, MacOSX, BSD and Gentoo. Please contact us if you cannot find what you need.

Rabbitbal a reverse proxy for Rails (as well as other web frameworks, not necessarily limited to Ruby)
Workling now supports RabbitMQ
RabbitMQ with Passenger and other frameworks

client library code
txAMQP: Twisted AMQP

Orbited, JavaScript/HTML socket in the browser

Celery, a distributed task queue for Django

AS3, Haxe and Flex
JSON/HTTP, our experimental project, rabbitmq-http2 and code
Experimental RabbitMQ-C client. You can also try this community C Client

Erlang development

Erlang examples
CouchDB
See also RabbitMQ Couch Relay
XMPP adaptor. See also "rabbiter", an experiment in decentralised microblogging
RabbitMQ and Scala - a popular tutorial and screencast that should be of interest for users of other languages too
CL-RABBIT, an interface from LispWorks to RabbitMQ

doc:div.p: Management and monitoring tools are provided by RabbitMQ and several new community tools have appeared for 'dashboard' access to core management functionality. Please treat these as experimental and send feedback to the list:

ul.li: Cony a HTTP based service written in Python for providing insight into running RabbitMQ processes
Trixx an administration and monitoring tool written in Clojure so available for all languages that run on JVM
RESTful administration and WebUI - Alice and Wonderland. Please read the release notes first.
More information on the open standard: Advanced Message Queuing Protocol
Writing your own AMQP client or management console
A report of high performance testing done by Intel in 2007, and an analysis by one of our team
Talk to us on irc.freenode.net #rabbitmq (see logs), or join our mailing list (see archived messages)
Open Enterprise's series on messaging middleware and AMQP Part 1, Part 2, Part 3

li.a: Why you might need messaging - a general introduction by Bob Pasker

ul.li: Another good introduction to why you might need messaging, presented at Rails Conf 2008 by Jon Dahl

li.a: Scaling your achitecture using events - includes an introduction to AMQP

ul.li: What people are saying on Twitter and on the web
See wikipedia on AMQP
